mouseOverData.text: 13th C. - present

location.millName: Moulin d'Arches (sur le rupt de Ravon)

mouseOverData.text: Le moulin Marc, 1470-(1577). Le moulin Allexys, 1492-1572. Le Gras Bernard or la Huate, 1494-1891.
This city is currently called Bains-les-Bains,but is cited as Bains in Janot's Les moulins à papier de la région vosgienne.
12th - 16th C.
Founded 1397. It is not certain that this mill was active during the period of 1450-1500.
12th - 16th C.

Hans Zürcher, St. Albantal No. 27, Upper Spiegel Mill, 1489-1494. Peter Höflin, St. Albantal No. 31, Upper Spiegel Mill, 1472-1487. Michael Gernler, St. Albantal No. 31, Upper Spiegel Mill, 1487-1413. Antonio and Michael Galliziani, St. Albantal No. 35, Klingental Mill, 1453-1494? Franz Galliziani, St. Albantal No. 35, Klingental Mill, 1494-1523. Antonio Galliziani, St. Albantal No. 37, Stegreif Mill, 1482-1486. Franz Galliziani, St. Albantal No. 37, Stegreif Mill, 1486-1523. Heinrich Halbysen I, St. Albantal No. 41, Rychmühle, 1488-1451. Heinrich Halbysen II, St. Albantal No. 41, Rychmühle, 1451-1467. Michael Galliziani, St. Albantal No. 41, Rychmühle, 1467-1494. Lufft Hans, St. Albantal No. 41, Rychmühle, 1494-1515. Heinrich Halbysen I, St. Albantal No. 39, Zunziger Mill, 1449-1451. Heinrich Halbysen II, St. Albantal No. 39, Zunziger Mill, 1451-1470. Ulrich Zurcher, St. Albantal No. 39, Zunziger Mill, 1470-1486. Hans Strub, St. Albantal No. 39, Zunziger Mill, 1486-1494. Conrad Wesslin, St. Albantal No. 39, Zunziger Mill, 1494-1496. Hans Kielhammer, St. Albantal No. 39, Zunziger Mill, 1496-1523.

Merten van Canegom, 1475; Willems fils du papetier, 1490; Hennen le papetier, 1498.

1) Johann Haller, Czaiowice Mill, 1491. Eineder states "Czaiowice is one of the paper-mills of Cracow (Further paper-mills in Cracow were: Pradnik, Rauchmühle and Froschmühle)" (pp. XCVI, 155). Hunter and Basanoff cite "Pradnik Czerwony, near Kraków." (Hunter, p. 477). Pradnik Czerwony is listed as an outlying district of Kraków. 2) Pradnik-Duchacki Mill, 1450. Basanoff calls this mill Pradnik Duchacki, as does Hunter, who adds that papermaker Frédéric Szyling worked here around 1495, (Hunter, p. 477, citing Lucia Merecki Borski). Although no location called Pradnik Duchacki was found, there are two districts in Kraków called Pradnik Czerwony and Wola Duchacka. Eineder refers to this mill as Pradnik (pp. XCVI, 155). 3) Moglia-Cracow Mill, 1450 (Basanoff cites as Mogila).
Founded 12th-13th C. It is not certain that this mill was active during the period of 1450-1500.

Founded 1351. Nicolaï places Moulin de la Pielle near Troyes. It is not certain that this mill was active during the period of 1450-1500.
Eineder states "A mill was founded about this date (1500), known as the Trautenau Mill and also as the Aupa Mill." (pp. XCVI, 131)
12th-16th C.
Founded 1348. In region of Barrois. Basanoff spells the town Saulx and Nicolaï spells it Saux. It is not certain that this mill was active during the period of 1450-1500.
Founded 1406. It is not certain that this mill was active during the period of 1450-1500.
c. 1498-1860. Mathes Klauber is cited as "tenant for life" (Eineder, pp. XCVI, 56), thus it is not certain that he was the owner of the mill.

1499 - c. 1696. Eineder states "1499: King Vratislav permitted the miller of the Abbot of Konigsaal to buy rags and make paper, but further details are lacking. If this licence became effective, then Konigsaal is the most ancient paper-mill of Bohemia and this is the oldest record relating to a paper-mill in this kingdom." (pp. XCVI, 121). Basanoff places this mill between 1390-1450.
